Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay..........”
Reviews.Author: kenandpatricia
Reviews.Content: Just got back from four days in PDC and choose to stay at Aqualuna. What a great little boutique hotel and what makes it so good are the employees. They went out of their way to help in any way they could and that's what counts. The place was spotless and had some nice little touches, like free internet, coffee and a charming little place to sit in the courtyard. Plus lots of options through associations with different beach clubs. Then nice and peaceful when returning after a night out.

Reviews.Title: “Great service highlighted a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Teebird150
Reviews.Content: arriving from the ferry with our luggage we were hot and sweaty. the great service began by Julio giving us water and a cold towel at check in. We knew then we chose the right hotel. Every single staff member we encountered we friendly and extremely helpful. Thank you Jorge for the towels after we got caught in a rainstorm. The rooms were a good size and always kept clean by the awsome Rosi. location is close enough to the main drag of 5th ave but far enough away to escape the noise. we loved having the beach towel service and access to some beach clubs to chill at. free wifi is a welcome touch as is the cute courtyard. The only minor minor grip is the pillows are really bad. But that is subjective. I would definitely stay here again! Jason&suzanne Vancouver bc

Reviews.Title: “playa botique”
Reviews.Author: docboy711
Reviews.Content: Clean, simple hotel a few blocks from all the action. Friendly staff, breakfast at sister hotel a few blocks down , get passes for mamitas beach club. Great spot to explore the city of playa del carmen!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice an cozy”
Reviews.Author: Dannha
Reviews.Content: Beautiful design, comfy bed, Great location and a wonderful staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, cosy and affordable gem in pricey Playa”
Reviews.Author: GlennO1
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the AquaLuna Hotel due to it's proximity to the beach, fresh decor, affordable prices and quiet location a block away from the main drag in Playa del Carmen, and felt at home the moment we stepped out of the taxi and were greeted by the extraordinarily friendly and knowledgable staff. The room was a very pleasant surprise, with fresh white paint, sublime decor, festive towel presentation, a spacious bathroom and comfortable beds. Though there was no natural light to speak of from the window to the backyard, it still felt airy and bright, and the thorough daily room maintance made it a joy to return sweaty and sandy from the beach every afternoon. Of course, the hotel offers little in the way of amenities, except for the coffee machine and couch in the tropical communal garden, and you have to go elsewhere for a pool area and breakfast, which are both on offer at the AquaLunas larger sister hotel further up the street, but were an unattractive option since you can get a better breakfast at the same price elsewhere in Playa (and have way more fun at the beach). What the AquaLuna does offer is a friendly, safe, quiet, affordable and excellently located base for those who wish to enjoy and explore Playa del Carmen and the surrounding area without blowing the budget. During our stay here we had absolutely no complaints, and found the hotel to be delivering on all of it's promises, thus being a hidden gem in a city where you often have to pay for more than you actually get.

Reviews.Title: “Muchas Gracias”
Reviews.Author: Gemma Q
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been more helpful! Thanks for amazing hospitality and friendliness- a great welcome to Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend Aqualuna Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juzt4fun
Reviews.Content: I am a solo traveller and i felt safe and enjoyed the clean comfortable accommodation at Aqualuna. My enquiries were attended to promptly, professionally and with the greatest of care. All of the staff made me feel like nothing was too much trouble and went out of their way to ensure that my stay was a wonderful experience. Aqualuna is very well located, walking distance to the beach, cafes and 5th Ave shopping. I highly recommend Aqualuna Boutique Hotel and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It just gets better each time but this time Holy Cow..!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1naturalist
Reviews.Content: Ok.. You have to read what they did for me. So I am not big on doing these reviews but after this visit on my big birthday I had to write about what they did. First off we stay here because it is central to playa just a street off 5th with all the great fun and food and South access to Ruins, Cenotes, Cozumel and Parks. Second we get a nice breakfast and access to the Mamita Beach club with fresh towels each day. We get wireless or can enjoy the PC access in the garden coffee spot with nice chairs to unwind. Now the gal Rosy that did the rooms each day for us was a Gem already and each day we got fun little things done on the bed with towel designs etc. Now how they knew it was my Birthday I am not sure. I think it was the cards in the room but when we got back from or Yard glass Margarita run at La Parilla (a must) we come in the room and our bed is decorated like a cake. Yeahh a cake (see pic) not only that but ballons and banners etc roses from Rosy and a card signed by all the staff. What.. yeah... all signed this card. Up to this point they were already so wonderful and helpful with our queries of the area. Really this was so so very special for my special day. When we were leaving in the AM 2 days later Rosy wanted a pic with us and we wanted one with here as well. Wonderful wonderful people and grounds exceeded our needs.

Reviews.Title: “It was exactly what we were looking for...”
Reviews.Author: Montona
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel and the people who worked there made our stay even better. Playa del Carmen was the last point in my trip through Mexico and in all places we were looking for hotels with character and personality and I can say Aqualuna was just perfect. Only 12 rooms and small tropical garden and sitting area with comfortable chairs, sofa and lots of books.. The room was simple but had everything we needed and especially shower was very very nice, the breakfast was very tasty(and i love eating) and staff was very friendly. I will probably just repeat the previous reviews but it was nothing negative that I can remember. Special thanks to house lady who made funny toys with towels that made us to laugh as soon as we entered room. Thanks to everyone who made our last days in Mexico to be remembered.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaKuMD
Reviews.Content: The location 1 block from 12th St (where all the big clubs are) is perfect. 3 blocks to beach, and they provide you with beach towels. Discount to local beach clubs. Good continental breakfast ($7) at sister property 5 blocks away. Basic amenties but clean and well kept grounds. Athough on major street, decent sound insulation. Super friendly staff. Free Wifi, coffee and water. Easy parking on the street. Only bad thing is bad water pressure in shower. But given this is a problem in a lot of Playa hotels, it should not be a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - cheap and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Malo66
Reviews.Content: My stay at Aqualuna was wonderful! Hotel very clean, and cheap and the location is just perfect. Close to everything and at the same time, a lot more quiet! The staff is very nice and helpful with wonderful advice about the places to go and see! Especially Marco! I recommend to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Great room at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: samjohnson4
Reviews.Content: My stay here was all-around very good! The hotel is beautiful, both inside the rooms, and in the courtyard, at the pool, etc. It is very close to many restaurants and bars, as well as 5th Avenue, the main street in the downtown area. All of the staff, especially Marco Berumen, are extremely friendly and helpful, as well as ready and willing to give helpful suggestions and tips as to where a some good food or nightlife is. I can't think of a single negative thing to say about the Aqualuna, and would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to go to Playa del Carmen, and wants to avoid the all-inclusive resort type of holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ruanto
Reviews.Content: Thank you tripadvisor for this hotel!Rooms are very spacious,nice and extremely clean.Breakfast was 3-4 blocks away in sister hotel but never mind some walk in beautiful morning.There was lots of choise-eggs.pancakes,fruits ,-excelent food. Hotel offer for free tea,coffee,cold and hot water 24 hours. Very good wifi internet.There is also PC if you dont have laptop.-for free. Best reception -very helpful .Thank you Casandra , Marco,Rosy

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, simple, clean, friendly and great value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: rigolecm
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose this hotel based on the extremely reasonable price. And for what we paid, we were extremely happy. The one thing that made our stay at Aqualuna exceptional was the staff! Everyone we interacted with was VERY friendly, very helpful and really went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. On the day of our departure, one of the staff brought us sandwiches to take to the airport with us to avoid having to pay for expensive airport food. And, Marco was so welcoming and friendly and had such a positive energy. He really made us feel at home. The rooms were clean and simple, which is all we really needed. We didn't travel to Mexico to stay in the hotel all day. Our goal was to get out, experience the city, spend time on the beach and take an adventure. Aqualuna was a perfect fit. It was a quiet sanctuary for us to relax at the end of our days, off the main strip but close enough to easily access the beach and 5th ave. with a short walk. The room attendant kept our room clean and organized and added special touches that gave us a smile when we returned "home" each night. The breakfast at the sister hotel wasn't amazing, but there were plenty of restaurants in the area. We actually preferred trying new restaurants for breakfast each day versus eating at the sister hotel every morning. We really enjoyed Karma Bagels. Over all, we had an amazing experience for a very reasonable price and would definitely recommend Aqualuna for those travelers looking to experience the city and not stay on a resort for the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: Dinosaurbird
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and the housekeeper made us feel welcomed by the extra touches in our room. Downside was the breakfast was the worst both my boyfriend and I had ever experienced! Eggs were super salty with hot dogs, and pancakes were like eating a kitchen sponge. Rooms were clean and simple and we would visit this hotel again. a mellow hotel given its location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: youdbetterbelizeit
Reviews.Content: Loved this little hotel. Rooms basic but very comfortable and clean. The staff were excellent and the service very good. Use of the pool and amenities at their sister hotel Hacienda Boutique, a few blocks away, was an added bonus. Very good location; not noisy but within walking distance of shops, bars, restaurants, beach, etc. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Served Its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: gemdomer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made a quick weekend trip to Playa del Carmen for some relaxation and beach time, and chose Aqualuna based on the great reviews and reasonable price ($100/night including breakfast on their website). We left the hotel totally underwhelmed. THE GOOD The hotel definitely had some good points, all apparent right upon arriving to the hotel: perfect location and wonderful staff. The location on 10th Avenue meant being close to the action on 5th Avenue without actually being on 5th Ave in the middle of all the the hubbub. 5th Avenue is quite long, almost a mile I would say, and Aqualuna is roughly halfway down the street, making it very convenient. It's also two blocks from several beach clubs. There was some street noise at night but the rooms were on the back side on the building away from the street, and the courtyard filled with trees and plants muffled most of the noise. The staff was definitely the best part of the hotel. Very friendly and trusting with great recommendations on things to do in the area. They even lent us beach towels for the day after we had checked out! Aqualuna doesn't have a Spa, but they have a lady who gives massages at their sister hotel down the street and I highly recommend it. She was wonderful and at $70 for a 90-minute massage, you really can't beat the price. THE MEDIOCRE The room was "meh," plain white walls and bedcoverings, flimsy closet and little shelf space. The room was definitely "basic." The TV was teeny, but we never turned it on. A/C was good, which is important. The bathroom amenities were organic but the exfoliating soap was a little rough. THE POOR There were a couple of areas which really brought down our opinion of the whole hotel. The breakfast is not served at the Aqualuna but at their sister hotel about three blocks away. This was no big deal, they gave us a ticket which we turned in over at the other hotel. However, the "hacienda style buffet" was anything but. There were exactly four hot items, two of which were either empty or of questionable quality (ie, ham & cheese sandwich on sliced bread and billed as "panini"). There were three juice containers, usually empty, as well as serve-yourself coffee and milk (milk was also out), fruit, bread, and yogurt. There were some staff members running around but no one ever greeted us or ever approached our table in three days. Meanwhile, we saw them profusely welcome a large group that came in and offer to make them anything they wanted to-order. I did order a cappuccino at the bar, and it appeared on our bill at the end of the stay. On our last day we went out to breakfast, even though we had already paid for it at the hotel. The shower was another area that was disappointing at least, frustrating at most. It is a large rainshower, but the showerhead is so calcified that the water sprays randomly in all directions ("like real raindrops!" my husband said). It was impossible to get clean. Also the drain filter was loose and popped out once in the middle of a shower. Not to mention that the water never got above lukewarm. I tried to use the hose-like implement that was installed in the shower, in an attempt for better water pressure, but for some reason the water coming out of the hose was always freezing cold, regardless of the temperature of the water from the showerhead. The third area that I would definitely rate as poor was the bed quality. This was easily the hardest bed I've ever slept on, and that's saying something considering that I have traveled extensively throughout Mexico, land of firm beds. There were two tiny pillows. CONCLUSION I really want to recommend this hotel based on the wonderful staff who really made our weekend great, but I just can't. Even if we hadn't gotten the breakfast, I just don't think the hotel is worth the $80 rate advertised on their website this time of year ($100 with breakfast). Even if you just need a clean room, the hard bed and crazy shower make me have to give it a thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “great service and location”
Reviews.Author: grandslam2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. We had been traveling around the area for two weeks and needed a place for a couple of nights. The location was perfect. A short walk to the beach and 5th ave .The staff was very friendly and accommodating, the rooms were clean and had every thing we needed, the garden area was a nice place to chill, with the computer and complimentary coffee and water. The room came with breakfast, which was at one of their other properties, so we did have to walk to get breakfast, but it was short, and so worth it. All in all, we would certainly return to this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive hotel with great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Patricia33524
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Aqualuna was great! Above our expectations. All the staff were friendly, helpful and spoke great English. The hotel was conveniently located to 5th and not far from the best beaches. They had a great deal with Mamitas Beach Club with discounted food and chair/umbrella rental. The hotel had a nice open courtyard full of tropical plants and two nice seating areas with a use of a computer and books. The room was comfortable and very clean with wonderful hair/body products. The bed was a little hard but we had no problems sleeping after a hard day at the beach. We will stay at Aqualuna again and would highly recommend the hotel for the price, location, friendly helpful staff and the clean rooms. Thanks especially to all the great staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and cosy hotel to stay in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: silviaPossetto
Reviews.Content: we had a fantastic stay in Aqualuna hotel in Playa del Carmen. The hotel is situated in the town centre, 2 minutes walking distance to the beach. The staff are very friendly and available 24 hours a day. The hotel has a quiet atmosphere and we liked to relax in the beautiful outside area where Internet ,water, tea and coffee are always available free of charge. We spent 14 nights in this hotel and we felt really at home. We build up a lovely relation with all the management and all the staff, especially with Yami and Daniela who always welcome us and made sure we were happy with all services. If you are looking for a pleasant holiday this is the place to stay!!!!! Thank you to all the staff!! Silvia and Amerigo from Brighton ( UK)

Reviews.Title: “grazie,grazie,grazie.”
Reviews.Author: cmrobert955
Reviews.Content: just one word that is coming up to me and my partner and that is again, thank you very much for helping us out when we needed it the most. your hotel is lovely,great service,wonderfull friendly staff and householdstaf the room are more than comfortable,clear and daily fresch towels. perfect surroundings,near in the center and beaches. just try it all out you readers of tripadvisor. we had a perfect week in this hotel,its great and more the staff is more than friendly and kind.they are very professional. the breakfast in the sister hotel is very good and tastefull. just 5min working from ,aqua luna hotel.just do it .

Reviews.Title: “Aqualuna-you will love it”
Reviews.Author: endlesssummer06
Reviews.Content: Aqualuna hotel is a small, relaxing hotel with excellent service, great location for a reasonable price. We stayed at one of their sister hotel the year earlier but this is the gem of the three. Beach club, towels and breakfast are included, they made us feel more welcomed than family. We will definintely go back to Aqualuna, Yami the maid and Marcos the night desk guy were fantastic and incredible helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at great price....”
Reviews.Author: saucypaw
Reviews.Content: After months of exhaustive research on tripadvisor, we chose Aqualuna based on reviews and price and we couldn’t be happier with our choice. From the moment we arrived the staff at Aqualuna made us feel welcome and helped to make our first visit to Playa Del Carmen a memorable one. We stayed 2 nights at the beginning of our trip before heading to Belize and Isla Mujeres. We had such a wonderful time we decided to return to Playa to end our trip. The decision to stay at Aqualuna was no brainer. We stayed at many hotels on our 17 day vacation and this was by far the best. We even recommended the place to several travelers we met in Belize. When we returned to the hotel they remembered us by name and thanked us for the recommendation. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful with native plants and an enjoyable courtyard offering 24 hour free coffee and internet. Rooms are spacious and clean which is all I really require. The ice cold ac and cable were just a perk. Everyone on the staff were wonderful, Robert the manager helped us with a small issue we had upon arrival and everyone (Irais, Cassandra, Marco...) we encountered at the front desk were wonderful. Yami the housekeeper was great and greeted us daily with a warm smile and was very patient with my limited Spanish. The Aqualuna offers the luxury of a boutique hotel at a reasonable price and I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this place to anyone I know. .

Reviews.Title: “For the price,is god!!!”
Reviews.Author: renatacastro21
Reviews.Content: Is nice!Without lux,very simple....the people is nice. Just one problem ,the bed is so small.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Good Value, Excellent Location and Enjoyable Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidandJeff
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the warm friendliness of Marcos which was a great welcome to this lovely hotel...the position is perfect being in 10th Avenue (one street up from 5th and you don't really want to be in 5th given noise and crush) set amongst palms and with a restful tea and coffee area...the rooms are of a good quality with air-con and a fan (you need it here) and with wonderful natural cosmetics...staff were great, the most friendly we met in Mexico...the breakfast at Hacienda Paradise (a sister hotel four short blocks away) is good value (better than most restaurants in town)...overall, we loved our stay here and believe that for Playa (which is expensive) this is excellent value for a superior tourist class hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, GREAT staff, and in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SeattleStanT
Reviews.Content: I have traveled a lot around the world, stayed at 5 star hotels and -1 star hotels. The Aqualuna hotel is small but I would give it a 5 star rating because if you understand what you are getting for the price it is top notch, one of the best hotels I have found. Because of my recent experience I am just going to plan another two weeks with them next year. The staff are great, you could not ask for a nicer group of people and clearly they are there to help you have a good experience. The hotel is only two small blocks from the beach and is safe and secure. You have a "hard" bed according to fat American standards, but you have to understand that the bed is built into the structure because it helps make it hurricane compatible. The mattress is good, you'll get used to it. Plenty of hot water, nice shower, clean bathroom, cable tv, mini fridge for my beer and juice, and in room air conditioner. They also have a pool at a sister hotel a few blocks away but I preferred the beach and ocean. What I learned in Playa was that basically you'll pay an extra $10 for each add on, pool in a courtyard, add another $10, on site restaurant, add another $10. Etc. It would be easy to double the price and end up paying for your own laziness. By that I mean, if you can't walk two blocks to a pool you are too lazy. If you can't walk across the street to one of many restaurants, you are too lazy. The location of Aqualuna is on a fairly busy street, 10 ave, so you will hear the morning traffic starting to build up around 6:30 - 7:00 am. But in the winter time the daylight is 7:00 - 5:00, so consider the wakeup traffic a plus, not a minus. You're there to enjoy and should not be wasting daylight. If you like to party late and sleep in, pick a more expensive hotel that is more isolated. If you like to get up and go, it is the perfect place. Just a short walk of one block and you are on 5 ave, that's the main cobblestone/brick walk where all of the shops and restaurants are. Remember that on the map the streets go in 5's, so each single block is 5 more than the last one. For example, 10 ave is only two blocks from the beach. It goes, 10 ave, 5 ave, beach. So the location of Aqualuna is really right where you want to be in the first place. Why pay more to be closer. Also, a lot of the shops cater to western tourists, so there is much cheaper and probably better tasting food in the higher numbered streets where you start to see locals eating. For example a breakfast on 5 ave, say $10, becomes $5 on 15 ave or 20 ave, and that's only 3 blocks!! Also, the same is true for shopping, find what you like but don't buy it, walk a few blocks "away" from the tourist zone, and you'll find better bargains. I'm not really a bargain shopper, but I wanted to point this out for all you considering Playa. In my opinion, don't bother renting a car, the bus system is top notch, large comfortable air conditioned buses drive every 50 minutes from Playa to the south like Tulum. The bus costs $4-5 depending on destination. Buses to and from Cancun run more frequently. My writing here is a little bit like a tourist guide, but I wanted to portray a low cost vacation that you can have by staying at a good hotel and using local knowledge. The Aqualuna hotel is now one of my favorites, if you're not a snobby spoiled tourist you'll really appreciate this jewel in Playa. You won't be disappointed. Stan from Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: houliganski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aqualuna for 2 nights out of 5 in PDC. I truly think that it is overrated on Tripadvisor. We booked it directly from the hotel, and got the Experience Deal (2 night min applied), $39.00 per night+ tax, which comes up to almost $50.00 per night. The room we stayed in was small, had ants and chunks of salsa on the desk when we checked in. The bed was hard as a rock. The room had a TV with cable, high-speed internet, in-room safe and a hair dryer. There is a media room and a library available for use. The hotel also provides unlimited tea/coffee for the guests, which I think is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Such a relaxing,homey feel to the place,it was like staying with friends.”
Reviews.Author: travel253
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Mexico after spending 4 nights at the Aqualuna and 3 nights at the Radisson in Cancun. Aqualuna was the best ! We should have spent our entire time here. From check-in to check-out we felt as though we were staying with friends. Gaspar was the "compadre" we never new we had. His welcome smile and the welcome beverage was well worth the long trip from the U.S. If you're looking for clean rooms and decent rates,this is the place to stay. The hotel is just a short walk from Av.5 and all the shops and restaurants. For someone with bad knees like me,the short walk was a blessing. Cassandra,the desk clerk should also be mentioned as she too, always had a smile for us. Will definately stay here again. We highly recommend the Aqualuna !!

Reviews.Title: “chic & cheap”
Reviews.Author: harpersmom
Reviews.Content: One of the cheapest hotels I could find, and it turned out to be very nice. The room was very clean and decorated in a pristine modern tropical style. The staff was very helpful; loved the lush gardens and location...close to the beach and main shopping street. Don't hesitate to book this hotel! Free parking in front, if full that is a secure parking garage right next door.

Reviews.Title: “the aqualuna staff are my new best friends!”
Reviews.Author: denahanold
Reviews.Content: i have been here in Aqualuna Hotel for several days, and continue to be amazed by the accommodating staff. every little need or request is handled in the most efficient, friendly manner - whether it involves finding a safe place for my bike, fixing the air conditioner remote, or researching to find my favorite chocolate in town - from each and every employee. Gaspar is the first gentleman i talked to when i first came into the hotel. he made me feel quite at home right away with his easy, professional and friendly manner. if i owned a hotel, i would try to recruit him to work for me! vanessa was very helpful as well, when i had a particular problem. other names do not come to me, but everyone, Everyone, has been the best i could hope for. my life and business are in my computer, so strong, dependable wifi is a must for me. the signal was strong in my room and in the pleasant outdoor sitting areas.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mexmate
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised with the hotel, I paid for a standard room and i wasn't really expecting a descent size room, but it turned out to be a really nice one, very quiet, very nice standing shower, good size. Over all, it was an excellent experience. Althought the hotel it's great, I have to say that the best part is the customer service, I personally work in the hospitality business and i am used to high standards of customer service. All the staff, from housekeeping, to front office, from F&B to concierge were amazing. I usually don't name individuals but in this case as I have to do so, as there were two members of staff that went the extra mile to exceed my expectations, Miriam from Housekeeping and Gaspar from Front Office

Reviews.Title: “Great small Boutique Hotel right in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: alcapitol
Reviews.Content: We loved Aqualuna boutique hotel during our stay in july. The service was very friendly and even more professional than any other hotel we visited so far. The hotel is just off the 5th avenue and walking distance to everything. Went to Cozumel island and Isla Mujeres during our stay because the hotel is located blocks away from the ferry dock. They gave us very good suggestions and before the end of our trip we even decided to go to Holbox Island for the swimming experience of a lifetime…the whale shark. Upon departure we decided to go back to Playa for one night instead of Cancun and we took the ADO bus direct to the airport because the bus terminal was also walking distance from the hotel. The hotel also provides great pricing on tours. We did the Chichen Itza tour through the sister hotel concierge and couldn't have been more pleased since we were having a lovely and abundant breakfast there anyhow. Definitely we shall return to Playa Del Carmen! Al & Julie

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful European experience, great value for the $”
Reviews.Author: ersatzsuperjew
Reviews.Content: My b/f and I are what you would call 'nerdy researcher travelers' from the cold North,and we wanted a quiet, affordable, minimal, classy hotel with the basic amenities from which to avail ourselves of all of the richness of the Yucatan. What follows is a long list of what is great about the hotel, but here are a couple brief "negative marks": -Bed was very hard and this gave my b/f some back issues -Not enough pillows, though more were provided on request The Aqualuna is the perfect place for such travelers, who don't need a lot of hand holding but do need a good touch of elegance, European hospitality, and the basic amenities to make their stay relaxing. It allows you a nice home base from which to explore, knowing that when you come back from a crazy day exploring nature preserves, that your sparkling clean room with AC will be there waiting for you. At this hotel you don't get a bunch of things you don't need like a huge rec room or elevator, and therefore these are not factored into the cost of the room. However, laundry service, in-room phone, concierge, luggage storing, towel service, breakfast (at sister hotel), pool (at sister hotel), yoga/massage (at sister hotel) and organized tours are all available. The hotel is physically very attractive--a whitewashed Grecian island-esque building on the corner of Avenida 10 and Calle 14, it is within a minute's walk of the crazy pedestrian walk "La Quinta" and still feels like a world away from the commercial side of playa. There is a covered open-air rec area in the atrium of the hotel, replete with palms and other tropical plants, where you can get filtered water and make coffee, surf the internet, or chill out on the chaise (and smoke if you like). I should mention this area looks more like a hip club than like a typical hotel common room. The in-room amenities were delightful. The shampoo/soaps were all locally made and the Mayan honey shampoo smelled so good and was rich that I would have bought a larger size if it was on sale. The green herb-infused body was was also excellent and smelled a little bit like the aperitif Chartreuse. In our room, we were greeted daily with varying types of towel sculptures, including a huge towel swan complete with googly eyes. Clearly someone on staff has an inner artist manifesting in the form of towel design. Gaspar, our host, was exceedingly welcoming and accomodating and answered all of our questions, including that of street parking (we rented a car for our week in Mexico) and shopping (there are huge American style mega stores nearby). Just next door there are two cute taquerias to satisfy your snacking urges. We recommend the rice-less burrito. A little further South down 10th Ave betw 8th/10th c, there is a little taqueria/juice stand called "Kiwi" which has excellent huge $2 fruit shakes and really good tacos. At the end of our trip, we finally did succumb to the pleasures of the beach, which the hotel happily supports by its liaison with the Mamitas Beach Club (something like $5 for a beach chair and umbrella for 2 people per day). Mamitas is a little bit of a walk away but is a very nice and Euro beach. Great people watching and very nice swimming. We booked the room on Expedia as an package deal (with air, hotel, and car) and I found this to be a great option as we had very few extra costs to pay at the stay - just the beach club costs and an optional donation to the social services charity that the Hotel subsidizes (a very worthwhile cause, especially if you get the chance to visit any of the Maya communities further inland). Each night was about $45 in the off season of mid-May. What a steal! Sometimes they have sales on their website if you book direct ahead of time. A great value for those wanting a chill-er playa experience.

Reviews.Title: “The European Touch”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoeur
Reviews.Content: Being 'Quebecois' means constantly looking for that European touch and spirit in our daily life. We were pleased to meet an Italian management in a Mediterranean style hotel. We only initially reserved for three nights because our vacation included other Mexican destinations, but anyhow decided to cancel our last night in Cancun to return to Playa del Carmen. Of course we chose Aqualuna once again and this made us somehow 'preferred' guests. We were given a more spacious room and also included a complimentary breakfast in their sister hotel. Throughout our stay, everyone tried to make us feel at home and, although no one is french mother tongue, they still greeted us (Vanessa) and in some cases communicated with us in french since the beginning (Max). Thank you. My spouse hardly understands English. But we received much more. We noticed true atention even in those issues which were not strictly related to our relation with the hotel. Their way of conceiving service extends to ensure that clients are relaxed and feel confortable at all times. We felt it when booking restaurants, tours and even when one of our bags was misplaced by the airline on day one. We strongly recommend Aqualuna and all those working in the hotel to those that at times would like to visit a destination, but are somehow blocked (my spouse!) by the uncertainty of the 'new' and having to deal with a foreign language. Rest usure, never will you feel a stranger. Help is issued as a way of life and you do not need to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews from Tripadvisor right on the money here.”
Reviews.Author: JanetFtMyersFL
Reviews.Content: Used Tripadvisor reviews to select Aqauluna Hotel for our last overnight in Playa del Carmen. It is as others have said. Small hotel, very clean nice room, convenient to town, but not noisy, with very helpful staff. Israel went to lengths of help us get our air boarding passes printed. They should mention that their pool and the included breakfast is actually at their sister hote 3-4 blocks away, but not really an inconvenience. Gaspar, upon checkin, recommended Ef Fogon for dinner which was a good local choice (a little hot and smokey). Great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Rockinahawdplayse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our first night in Playa. Very nice. Good location , short walk to 5th avenue and the beach. The staff was very freindly and helpfull. Quiet at night. Good price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, service from the staff, very clean and location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: HarleyR
Reviews.Content: In the past month I have stayed at the Aqualuna Hotel three times. Each visit was very pleasant due to a variety of reasons... The staff, especially Senor Gasper, was very helpful in many ways. The recommendations of the seafood restaurant "La Pesca" and the fruit stand/restaurant "El Nativo" were right on. La Pesca had a singer/guitar player by the name of Renee Rodriguez who sang many romantic spanish songs & was very good!! The seafood was very good and inexpensive too. The "Nativo" fruit restaurant had large bowls of fruit chopped up or in a blended drink, very good! Aqualuna Hotel had very clean rooms, great showers, a neat garden area and the towels were folded to imitate animals, very cool. Once, when my wife and daughter came to join me for a week, we had asked Senor Gasper what the mini suite was like. He not only showed us the mini suite but returned an hour later and explained that we had been upgraded to the mini suite at no charge!! On my first stay at the Aqualuna I was by myself and on my way to Cozumel to dive. I had asked Senor Gasper where to purchase some fruit for breakfast, he ofcourse, gave me some directions. That very afternoon i had a basket of fruit in my room upon my return! Another staff member, Yuri, is a very pretty young woman and when she smiled it would just light up the room! On my last visit at the Aqualuna they were booked full on one night so they set me up at another hotel, as the desk clerk showed me the room he pointed out a bowl of fruit. I asked him "do you always provide a bowl of fruit? his reply was ...no, the Aqualuna had informed him of this personal preferance! So, yes i will be returning to the Aqualuna again. I am no one special but when I stay there they make me feel very special!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and Value!”
Reviews.Author: kmrojas
Reviews.Content: First of all I just want to say that the staff although not completely bilingual in English provided better service than any 4-5 star hotel in the Area! The staff was incredibly friendly and even went out of their way to service in any way they could. It is definitely a hidden gem in Playa del Carmen. It is very small and sits on a corner of 10th ave and 14th St. it is very small with no restaurant or pool (but with great restaurants all around, I wouldn’t have to eat at the hotel anyway) but if you are looking for these amenities Aqualuna has a sister hotel a few blocks down called the Hacienda Paradise. It is also very green with tropical plants and tranquil sitting areas. I love the location because it is very close to walk 5th ave but far enough to be away from the crazy nightlife if you want to get some rest as well. We were also walking distance to the local Mega store and the delicious local restaurant El Fogon. Our last day there we were going on an all day tour and the staff offered to watch our luggage and even offered a shower room to freshen up after our all day tour. Simply awesome! They recommended many restaurants and warned us about any overpriced stores or scams we might encounter. Overall this isn’t a fancy resort; it’s very quaint and comfortable in a beautiful tropical setting. For the price of the room rates the hotel completely surpassed my expectations. I will definitely be coming back and staying at Aqualuna again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, best value for money in Playa...”
Reviews.Author: IrisLucerne
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 9 nights in total and we absolutely enjoyed the Aqualuna Hotel. Its in the very center of Playa del Carmen, just 2min. walk from the beach and all the action. The hotel is really clean, the staff extremely friendly and the atmosphere is just great... I have to say it must be the best value for money in whole Playa.. Love it, will definitely return to Aqualuna...

Reviews.Title: “The best hospitality I have ever experienced...ANYWHERE!!”
Reviews.Author: happyguy68
Reviews.Content: Mr. Gaspar Solis demonstraded by his actions that not only does he know what Infinity Hospitality means but that he truly believes in this concept as well. I traveled with a 4 yr old (my son) and his attention to us both to ensure that we went to the right places for an experience of a life time was nothing less than great. The Hotel did not provide for daycare services and Mr. Gaspar helped make arrangements for someone to help watch my son on one evening. I have had an increadible experience at Playa del Carmen and I have also made a great friend ion the process. Your company really needs to employ more poeple like Mr. Gaspar Solis. He truly desreves to be in a higher position so that he can teach others his dedication to the customer and his Company.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value”
Reviews.Author: VtravellingV
Reviews.Content: Close to the action, but not expensive. Very helpful, friendly staff and definitely clean, pleasant surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vinotinto2010
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel! I visit Playa Del Carmen regularly from New York and decided to try this quaint, mediterranean inspired hotel for my 10 day stay. First of all, the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, and when I decided to stay an extra night management upgraded me to a suite at no extra cost. The room in which I spent most of my stay was airy and romantic. Both rooms were always clean and well stocked. The hotel is reminiscent of Santorini, Greece, where I have spent time. The location is unbeatable too. One block from the 12th St nightlife, and one block from 5th Avenue, it still feels like it's hidden away and is surprisingly quiet. An optional breakfast is served a few short blocks away at their sister hotel in a peaceful, pretty poolside setting. Also spa and gym options. The overall value for money is amazing and I have stayed at various other hotels in Playa. Aqualuna is my new home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “What a cute hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nickeluring
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in the hotel for one night, but during our short stay we came to really like the hotel and the staff. The rooms are super neat, and we immediately felt at home. The staff was very friendly and did whatever they could to help us with all our issues, such as finding great restaurants, and storing luggage. Since we had a late flight and had to check out by noon, they let us come back at night to shower and change clothes. They had even arranged a personal shower for us in the communal area of the hotel, which they had set up with towels, soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion - yes anything we could have wished for. Excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, Italian touch and very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: erferfer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice spot. Reception was fabulous and Casandra was very helpful and made us feel welcome right from start. Vegetation is very tropical and the garden very well taken care of. Rooms are nice and cozy. Maybe not large but indeed comfortable…very comfortable. You can feel in both hotels Xperience Hotels manage there is a particular Italian touch. They provide breakfasts in the sister hotel Hacienda Paradise that is only steps away: fruit, granola, eggs, Mexican food and much more was readily available and it was really a great start. Free internet access both wireless and cable made our stay even more comfortable and we could get in touch daily with our relatives and friends. For those who don’t carry a laptop there is a nice area where you can read a book and check mails . All in all we would strongly recommend people to book their holiday at Aqualuna especially for their service and the attention to the details that they instill in their staff. At reception they constantly worry about your well being and they would go the extra mile to make you happy. Prepare yourself guys since we are coming back…definitely soon. Laurel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: tah11
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Aqualuna, which is a great alternative to all inclusive hotels. Since Playa del Carmen has fantastic restaurants, we did not want to limit our choices. We chose the Hacienda Style Mini Suite, which turned out to be great value. This included a balcony, spacious room, breakfast at a nearby hotel and beach club including umbrella and two chairs. The hotel staff were amazingly friendly and helpful. They really go out of their way to make your stay the best possible. The hotel is located steps away from 5th Avenida, near fabulous restaurants, beach, and shopping. Casandra, Gaspar, Giuseppi and Beppe were particularly noteworthy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: KatBB
Reviews.Content: I loved Aqualuna Hotel! It is excellent located (one block away from Quinta av), it has a great and delicious breakfast (you have to go to another hotel like 3 blocks away) and the personal was very kind. The rooms were very beautiful with a great A/C It was my wife's birthday and the maid created a cake out of towels and filled the bedroom with globes, it was a very nice gesture. If we go back to Playa we will definitely stay here again and we will recommend this hotel to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Aqualuna, would stay there again with no hesitation.”
Reviews.Author: KQ5
Reviews.Content: Gaspar was possibly the most friendly hotel staff person I have ever encountered, and his level of service was definitely present among other staff as well. Gaspar had wonderful recommendations for food options outside the tourist area. El Fagon and La Pesca were both great. Yache was also a fine suggestion. Taco place next door also not bad. Excellent location--one block from the main tourist area (5th Ave), and a little over 2 blocks from the beach. You also have access to facilities at their two sister hotels. The breakfast buffet is located one of the sister hotels, the Hacienda Paradise. You can purchase the buffet separately if it is not included in your room type. Buffet was good, but I would not choose it for every day, as we enjoyed some other local breakfast places for less money. Complimentary fresh beach towels are available for guest use and can be exchanged at any sister hotel. Room was clean and comfortable. Very firm beds. Good A/C. The only typical hotel amenities missing were an iron and alarm clock, but who needs either for the beach? Small flat panel TV, but not an important feature for me. Very resonable snacks for in-room purchase. Good maid service and cute towel animals daily. Really liked the atmosphere of the courtyard that our room overlooked. If you contact the hotel ahead of time, they will arrange resonable transportation to and from the airport that can be paid at the hotel. Much more relaxing than looking for a taxi at the airport. Loved our stay at Aqualuna. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “So nice to be back”
Reviews.Author: Hexctazy
Reviews.Content: Since it's been several years since we went for our honeymoon in Playa del Carmen, we thought of going back and this time staying at Hotel Aqualuna. This little jewel of a hotel was the perfect place for us. The staff is very educated according to five star standards and very eager to help. The rooms were clean and well appointed and since there are only about 10 rooms or so, the staff really gets to know you. We were given great advice by Gaspar for where to eat, what to do, what to avoid etc... Though Aqualuna is not on the beach it is only a short walk away. We took the advice of another Aqualuna reviewer and stayed at Wickys beach club. Food and drinks are very reasonable and the staff there was attentive and nice. We would rather go back to Aqualuna over the large all-inclusive resorts. We read all reviews and found that a very few were mentioning the noise level in the rooms from the Avenida. At first we were a bit skeptic but indeed, we had no problem sleeping. Things really quiet down around 10 p.m and therefore no problems at all…plus you’re right where all the action is…so you don’t have to worry about going back to the hotel after a few drinks… The breakfast held in the garden of the sister hotel was excellent with plenty of offerings. The hotel looks very nice too and you can share common services there like eatng at their restaurant and not carry $ with you. You can have everything put on the hotel bill. Also On Fifth Avenida there are plenty of Mexican and Italian restaurants as well as bars. There is plenty of shopping, beach and side trips from Playa del Carmen. Try asking the concierge at Hacienda Paradise and go down to the ruins of Tulum, coba’ and Chichen Itza. Very professional and good value for money. Once again Playa del Carmen confirms to be our little spot in the Caribbean and Aqualuna the pearl that we would recommend to all those liking a non packaged holiday like we do! Rob and Nancy

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel13
Reviews.Content: The positive reviews and affordable price were the deciding factors in booking Aqualuna. Again, this is a basic, small hotel with no amenities. The staff is excellent and makes every attempt to accomodate your requests. Our room was quite small, and we were awakened by street noise of late night partyers leaving the clubs. Because of room size, and noise I would not return again.

Reviews.Title: “Desceptive based on Trip Advisor reviews”
Reviews.Author: oologah
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews and seeing that it was rated such a value compared to like hotels I was surprised at what it was really like. Housekeeping was above average, but maintenance and upkeep of facilities was below average. The front desk personnel were attentative and helpfull. Location was as expected, close to most everything and had transportation readily available. If you like sleeping on a rock hard bed, then this is the place. Noise levels were acceptable. I booked family members at a neighboring hotel because they booked too late to get a room at Aqualuna and I am glad it worked out that way. Their hotel was the same price and it was much closer to the beach, had more amenities, and larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Don't Expect Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Xian3
Reviews.Content: I think the reviews are more or less on the mark here, except the ones who are horrified to find out that this small hotel in a beach town in Mexico doesn't handle service exactly the same way as, say, a Hyatt in Chicago. Um, with all due respect: duh. Playa del Carmen has developed very quickly, and now has plenty of overpriced, underperforming (or noisy!) accommodations, especially on the beach and on Avenida 5. Aqualuna is the perfect antidote to this. If you're an experienced international traveler, and looking for something that provides a great balance of quality, value and convenience, this is a really outstanding option. All in all, an excellent value, and we were mostly quite charmed by the attractive facility and nice people. Not luxurious, but well done. But if you're maybe new to places like Mexico, and prefer big chain hotels when you travel domestically, you'll probably prefer another option. Rooms are spacious and attractive, in the local style of whitewashed concrete or stucco. This isn't everyone's cup of tea, but seems just right for the beach. Desk service is very good and very helpful, but remember that it's a small hotel. For instance, they sometimes have to run around the corner to their sister property to process a credit card transaction. This is pretty standard for the developing world, but these guys hustle when they do it, explain what's happening, and apologize for the inconvenience. Just right. Why pay double or triple at a big resort-y place to save the 5 minutes? The rooms aren't plush or anything, but have all the basics you need, including Wi-Fi and a flat-screen TV. There's a safe big enough for a netbook, a fridge, etc. I think beds should always err on the side of firm over soft, but this one might be a touch firmer than is really necessary. Good, but stiff. Bathrooms are good. Power was reliable. They provide plenty of bottled water. The common areas are quite lovely and peaceful outdoor spaces to hang out. The location is outstanding, as it's just far enough off of Avenida 5 to be quiet, and just close enough to the services there that you never mind the walk. Also, it's far enough north to get past the tackier, busier parts of the town. The best restaurants and bars are very close by. (John Gray's is pricey, but well worth a visit. Wonderful lamb with Asian slaw! Plus, the taco van on 12th st. is super-cute, providing great tacos and excellent cheap breakfasts. ) Note that there is a road in front, and some rooms are close to the 'lobby', as it's a small hotel. So, if you're a light sleeper... just ask for a quiet room if you need one. I think we were in #8, which was interior and super quiet. We took advantage of the Yoga classes at their nearby sister hotel and strongly recommend them. The instructors are very nice, and technically are probably just above average, but the outdoor, upstairs studio is gorgeous: breezes, green trees, birds chirping. A glorious way to start the day. Also, the beach club access they provide gets you a nice chair & umbrella at a place a 15 min. walk away. It's nothing glorious, but a nice freebie. If you just want to swim, no need to bother with that: just walk straight to the nearest beach. But it's a nice place to spend an afternoon reading in the shade, or sunning yourself. If we had any real gripe, it would be the ditzy housekeeping. On my second day, I walked into my room hoping to use the restroom. The housekeeper was in the middle of cleaning. I used my basic Spanish to indicate I needed the bano. Instead of letting me use the loo quickly, she finished up for 10 min. while I waited in the hall. And she never pointed me to the now-obvious restrooms down by reception. Someone was also there on our last day while we were trying to depart. We explained that we were packing to go, and she just nodded and kept working. Had to ask her to leave and come back after we left. No big deal, but an inconvenience they could easily improve. All in all, an excellent value, and we were mostly quite charmed by the attractive facility and nice people. Not luxurious, but well done.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, just not over-enthusiastically.”
Reviews.Author: bighassle
Reviews.Content: My feelings on the Aqualuna are a bit mixed. The employees were mostly very nice and helpful. The room (though smaller than expected) was clean and affordable, with free wi-fi access and a computer for guests in an office behind the front desk. The hotel feels nicely tucked away, yet still convenient and within walking distance to everything. There's even a very pleasant little courtyard to relax in. What I did not like, however, was that they found our asking for a room with two beds to be a complete surprise (our Orbitz confirmation said two double beds OR a queen), like they'd never heard of such a request. So that was a bit of a hassle. Ultimately we did get a room with two beds, but it was right around the corner from the check-in desk, so we did hear people talking and going in/out throughout the night -- so it felt safe, but not really private. Meanwhile, at check-out, the maid told the desk people that we used mini-bar items that we did not even see. (We had noticed some mini-bar items were opened and half-eaten by previous guests obviously being sneaky, which was kind of gross and made the maid's claim a minor insult, in my opinion.) Overall, It's a cute and decent place for a good price, but it didn't feel "new" or "chic" as another website stated.

Reviews.Title: “Great value blocks away from the center”
Reviews.Author: deep_harbor
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was listed as a top value and we were not the least bit disappointed. The room was spacious and clean with a high speed wireless connection after a few days off the grid. Being away from the nightclubs was relief as we had read other hotel reviews that were close and loud - no problem here. The fellow who checked us in took great pains to describe the faciliites and what was available to us in terms of beach clubs, shopping, breakfast etc. All in all we had a short but great stay.

Reviews.Title: “quiet little hideaway of a hotel, close to 5th Avenue”
Reviews.Author: ToniaOR
Reviews.Content: 3 of my sisters and I stayed at Aqualuna for our 5th and final night in Playa del Carmen because of lack of availability after 4 nights at their sister hotel Hacienda Paradise. The hotel is situated on 10th, just one block from the busy walking street of 5th Ave. with its restaurants and stores. After you enter to the front desk, the curving paths, trees and plants and little seating area in white stucco make for a little hideaway from the bustle of the street. There you'll find bottled water, and a coffee pot. You are essentially still outside, as you proceed to the door of your room either on ground level or up an outside stucco stairway. We had 2 rooms separated by a little path, with a queen bed in each off this lovely courtyard. The rooms each featured a small, wall-mounted flat screen TV, over a little desk area; a comfortable, if a bit hard, bed with bedside buit-in tables/luggage shelves; nice painted-porcelain bowl sink area next to closet space with robes and a mini-bar and safe, outside a bathroom complete with walk in shower area and toilet. The hotel is a sister hotel to Karma hotel (just one block away, on 15th) and Hacienda Paradise (about 3 blocks away on 10th) where you can walk for your breakfast buffet. Although this hotel basically just has one front desk person, they seem to share facilities with the sister hotels. I think you can take a dip at the tiny pool at Karma or probably Hacienda Paradise's larger pool, as Aqualuna doesn't have a pool. The front desk will issue you a beach towel and they have vouchers for beach chairs and umbrella from Mamita's Beach Club, which you'll find off 28th after a walk to the white sand beach. They let us use the front desk computer for a quick check of email. For a little more staff and convenience (the pool, and breakfast on-site, as well as 2 lobby computers) the sister hotel Hacienda Paradise is better, but Aqualuna had a quieter, hideaway feel.

Reviews.Title: “no customer service”
Reviews.Author: westcoast88
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in advance, and had a confirmation e-mail. When we arrived, the hotel was closed. I had not received any message from the hotel about this. So we had to start looking around for a hotel with vacancy. Very unprofessional on their part.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Ely10
Reviews.Content: My partner and I traveled to Playa del Carmen and stayed for 6 days in Aqualuna and stayed in one of standard rooms. Aqualuna is set right across the fifth Avenue but maintains a very intimate and calm atmosphere. It is a short walk to the beach and to the restaurant where they serve a complete buffet breakfast. The staff was very helpful and organized multiple tours for us. Any requests we had for food, tours, and restaurant recommendations were handled fast. The price of the rooms are very competitive than other places with similar facilities but the level of service and amenities make it worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: OmarVL
Reviews.Content: Beautiful newly refurbished hotel. Great location and good value for money. It is part of a group of three hotels all the in the same area, which means you get access to the facilities of the other 2 hotels. The drawbacks of this little place is that it doesnt have a restaurant, parking or internet. These you can access in the other hotels thou (apart form parking). Having said that, the service you get from each and all the staff make up for these minor drawbacks

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ade127
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my recent stay, over new year, at the Aqualuna. On 10th Ave it is close enough to 5th.Ave (3min walk) for all the action, bars, restaurants and shops, but far enough away for a peacefull nights sleep. Don't worry about it not being on the beach, you have access to a beach club included. Breakfast, also excellent, is at it's sister hotel about a 5min walk away. The layout of the rooms is stylish and Meditteranean in feel. Clean, tidy, with very friendly and helpful staff (available 24hrs). Playa del Carmen is a unique place, you want to party all day and all night, you can party, you want to chill and relax, you can chill and relax. Close to Mayan sites for a bit of culture as well. Would highly recommend Coba and Tulum. A fantasic place to holiday and a very good hotel choice. Adrian

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience !”
Reviews.Author: jasmy90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the aqualuna for the Christmas holidays and we really had a great time. We have been to Playa before but not stayed at Aqualuna. We had wanted to stay at Playa del Karma where we had stayed before but they were full. The hotel looks nice from the outside as well from the inside. Room number 12 It had one king size bed and a sofa bed, tea coffee facilities, iron and board, safe, good sized bathroom and air con. Maid service was excellent and we were receiving daily different towel decorations. You also got nice organic soaps, shampoo's etc in the bathroom. Breakfast was also included in the price which is a bonus. We had it in the nearby hotel Hacienda Paradise. A great start for our days. The centre of Playa and the Quinta avenida are just a step away from the hotel. Beaches are beautiful and we got to enjoy the marine life in Cozumel too thanks to Jorge that gave us very good advices. Eventually we bought the excursions from them just because prices were on line with the rest of Playa, but much higher in quality than anyone else (we bought another excursion on the fifth Ave but were disappointed . We are definitely going back soon and will stay at Aqualuna again because its exceptional value It is really a fantastic experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetlife31
Reviews.Content: I visited Playa del Carmen few months ago and stayed at the Hotel Playa del Karma. This time I called again Ms. Sabrina and she told me that the Playa del Karma Hotel was fully booked and she book me in at another sister property managed by the same group, Xperience Hotels. Usually I’m reluctant in changing hotels, I stayed really well at the Playa del Karma during my previous stay, but what a surprise, the Aqualuna Hotel was a lot more than I was expecting!!! Nice small Boutique Hotel in the centre of Playa, literally is situated a minute walk from the famous 5a avenida and from the major night life attractions like for example the famous Coco Bongo (which is 30 seconds walking distance). I though that was going to be a noisy area but when I was in the room it was quite, I couldn’t hear any noise and had sweet dreams during my stay. The Hotel has been recently refurbished and is kept clean and tidy and the staff is very accommodating and customer service oriented. The rooms are spacious and furnished with all the necessary commodities, small flat screen TV, Air Condition, in room toilet, large shower, safety deposit box and a fully stocked minibar for which you pay a little extra. Breakfast is served in another sister property, the Hacienda Paradise that is only few blocks away from the Aqualuna Hotel. The housekeeping team is doing a wonderful job surprising you daily with a different towel fold decoration in the room. Definitely worth the price you pay for this beautiful “Boutique Hotel” and I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, this is the best hotel in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: Marinmen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Aqualuna Playa del Carmen for 7 nights and everything was outstanding!!! For the moderate price you pay you get an amazingly clean room, super friendly and helpful service, great location and a calm, pretty environment. Seriously we have not even a slight complaint about our stay, we couldn't be happier about our choice! Don't hesitate to book this hotel and ask for one of the upstairs rooms for they are nice and airy with a view of plants and flowers.

Reviews.Title: “Aqualuna - Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: crystal097
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aqualuna for 3 nites Dec 28 to 30th and have to agree with the previous recent comment" The staff are extremely friendly, the hotel is clean and a little oasis, our room was fine and it is very close to 5th avenue. However, the Cogo Bongo is a big problem for sure.....there is music, cars, people shouting and laughing until 4 am. we slept thru most of it cause we were so tired from the activities during the day, but once u wake up it is pretty loud. this is unfortunate since this is a quant place to stay with easy access to everything. Absolutely perfect except for this new nite club!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty”
Reviews.Author: feria9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Aqualuna this December and really liked the place! We had a gorgeous room with some lovely features. Staff were fabulous- always helpful and chatty. The only drawback was the noise... It gets pretty noisy at night! As the hotel is right beside a busy road, you will hear noise all the time. There is a big club very close to Aqualuna called Coco Bongo which is potentially very damaging to Aqualuna. Many drunk people at night so be prepare to hear some shouting. If the noise levels don't bother you too much then STAY IN AQUALUNA!! People there are very friendly which makes a big difference :-)

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: keithsam
Reviews.Content: It's been a year since we went but I must say it was an awesome experience! We were in Playa during the summer when it's very HOT! We stayed the first night at the Blue Parrot which is a nice place. (We only stayed at Blue Parrot out of obligation to my cousins wedding.) First off when calling there before arrival the lady was so nice and helpful, when traveling to another country I'm always a little skeptical. However when we arrived at the Aqualuna I turned to my wife and smiled because I knew we were in good hands. Our stay was for five nights and we enjoyed every minute. Playa Del Carmen is a wonderful place and I highly recommend a trip there. We had one issue, our package at the hotel included round trip transfer from the Cancun airport, well on the way in there was a mix up and no one was there to pick us up. So one quick call to the hotel and the lady there more than made up for it. I paid for our transportation to Playa and she deducted it from my overall hotel bill and then upgraded us for the inconvenience, my friends that's service!

Reviews.Title: “I lovedthis place!!”
Reviews.Author: rdoactv
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by Marco who was all smiles and "We've been expecting you." Nice and close to 5th Av. without all the noise. The beach is just a block beyond 5th Av. Lots of choices for meals in just about every direction. There is a laundry 3-4 doors down.....they did't speak english but sign language worked well and it was a good price. A pharmacy and OXXO (kida like a 7-11) right next to the laundy. No shortage of taxis if you don't want to walk. Ado bus station is a 15 min walk or $3.00 cab ride away. None of the taxi drivers seemed to know the location of the hotel unless you told them across from La Tortuga (the hotel directly across 10th from the AquaLuna). 10th can be a challenge to cross but patients is a virtue! Our room was the mini-suite very cute NICE A/C!! Very clean and neat. Had the essentials: TV, internet access, hair dyer, small coffe maker, iron/ironing board, and very small fridge. No alarm clock, though. Bed was hard but not bad once you got used to it. Beautiful courtyard with all kinds of tropical plants. There are lounge chairs and a table with seating and an umbrella if you want to bring dinner home and enjoy it in the courtyard. Cereal , toast, juice, fresh fruit, tea and coffee every morning in the beautiful courtyard. Cute towel animals on the bed every evening. I just adored this place. The staff was great and always really nice, especially Marco. Beach towels can be checked out each day at the front desk. I CANNOT SAY A BAD THING ABOUT THE AQUALUNA!!! If we visit Playa again we are staying at the Aqualuna! I would recommend this hotel to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “HIghly recommended”
Reviews.Author: lew58
Reviews.Content: This place is great for its price. It is one block from Fifth Avenue (the pedestrian zone) and about three blocks to the beach. The rooms are spotless and very tastefully decorated. The garden area is delightful and every morning there is coffee, tea, cereal, bread, etc. set out for breakfast. The staff speaks English and is very friendly and helpful. The rooms have a safe and closet space to put things away. The rooms are a little on the small side, but you don't really spend that much time in the room anyway. If you want the larger room, get the deluxe suite. It's sweet and very large! There is internet connection in all the rooms too (in case you bring your laptop). The staff also provides clean beach towels. This hotel is pretty quiet too since it's not right on the main shopping and partying street. There's no swimming pool though, so if you have kids that like to swim and play around in a pool, this might not be the best place for you. But if you want a clean, quiet, charming and welcoming place to stay, I highly recommend Aqualuna.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Vermontman
Reviews.Content: Aqualuna is a very nice, mid-priced hotel in Playa. It is very conveniently located to everything. Absolutely spotless everywhere. The rooms are charming, well decorated, and intimate. Great showers and bathrooms. Wireless works flawlessly. There is a really nice garden which, while small, takes you away from the streetnoise which you don't even notice (and I hate streetnoise). The design is very clever in that there is a Moorish sort of feel to the building which, when you really look at it, occupies a much smaller footprint than it feels. It really is a small place that has been made far more comfortable and enjoyable by the designer and architect. The only negative is the beds. I'm used to hard beds throughout Mexico but these are a step above in hardness. Didn't bother me a bit, but I include it here if you are sensitive. . Very nice staff. It attracted a nice group of people from many places in North America and Europe which was a definite plus. I'd stay here again without question. I paid $80/nt on a special, cheap by Playa standards.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: traveler07Usa
Reviews.Content: What a charming little hotel! The tropical garden lobby is delightful, the rooms are comfortable and attractive, and the staff are sweethearts. We also appreciated their guest booklet with suggestions on shopping and restaurants close by. We had dinner at one of their suggestions, John Gray's Place, which had fabulous food and a more romantic, laid back atmosphere than a lot of what we saw in Playa. The young English couple sitting next to us spent their mealtime planning their wedding --awww.The only negative we have is that although as others have said, the a/c drowns out street noise, it made a lot of grinding and rattling noises on our second night and started dripping water on my husband's head. We had to turn it off, and then the street noise is pretty bad, even though it's not on 5th ave. That's the only reason for the 4 rating; otherwise this place is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Aqualuna!”
Reviews.Author: yinyang1231
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aqualuna Hotel from December 26, 2007 through December 31, 2007. Despite some initial misgivings about the hotel due to a booking error on the part of the hotel staff, we really liked the Aqualuna from the moment of our arrival. The staff were friendly and very accommodating. Our room was very clean, comfortable and had many amenities that one would find in a much more expensive hotel (stocked mini-fridge, room safe, flat panel TV, huge walk-in shower). The lush tropical vegetation in the courtyard was absolutely beautiful and created a tranquil atmosphere for our daily continental breakfast or just for relaxing. The location cannot be beat, as the Aqualuna is just one block from busy 5th Ave. and 3 blocks from the beach. This is a great small hotel at a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: cpurvis
Reviews.Content: We just returned from celebrating our wedding anniversary in Playa del Carmen! Being veteran visitors of the area (have visited there for 5 years in a row), this hotel is one of Playa's best kept secrets! The staff at the front desk are amazing and wonderful people! Our room was clean, quiet, and promptly made up every morning. The included breakfast of croissants, toast, cereal, etc was good, but the coffee needs to be stronger. We are accustomed to the magnificent Mexican coffee (NO, don't go to Starbucks on the Avenida!), that Playa has to offer, and this is the only area where the Aqualuna fell a little short. Would recommend this boutique hotel to travelers who revel in the non-American hotel chain experience. If you're looking for a more "americanized, fast-food type of resort" this is NOT your place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aqualuna”
Reviews.Author: vgriffiths
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at Aqualuna. The friendly staff gave us excellent service. We stayed at two designer hotels on 5th Avenue but with all the noise until 3am, we decided to book in at Aqualuna for the remainder of our stay. They upgraded our room and gave us a discount. The building style is tastefully Mexican with a beautiful tropical garden. And its just a short walk to the beach. Vanessa Griffiths & Arno Joubert, South Africa

HotelInfo.Name: Aqualuna Boutique Hotel by Xperience Hotels
HotelInfo.Address: Av 10 Corn. calle 14 | col. centro, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
